title: [Yander's Farm, Farmland Road]
description: A juncture of three roads occurs amidst four different crop fields.  Culverts and ridges keep the fields from being accessible from this point.

A juncture of three roads occurs amidst four different crop fields.  Wheat grows directly to the north.  The even heights of the plants give the area the appearance of a long, flat sea of light and dark grey grain.  To the west a wide spiral of barley grows toward the heavens, while to the southwest long rows of corn, not yet tasseled, wave in the distance.  A turnip patch displays ribbons of turnip plants to the southeast.  Culverts and ridges keep the fields from being accessible from this point.

A juncture of three roads occurs amidst four different crop fields.  Wheat grows directly to the north.  The even heights of the plants give the area the appearance of a long, flat sea of golden and green grain.  To the west a wide spiral of barley grows toward the heavens, while to the southwest long rows of corn, not yet tasseled, wave in the distance.  A turnip patch displays ribbons of turnip plants to the southeast.  Culverts and ridges keep the fields from being accessible from this point.
